qas.question: Who defined the significant legislative changes?
What is one exemption was part of the significant changes in legislation?

answers.text: requirement that military forces and new taxes be approved by provincial Sejms

qas.question: What were the statutes issued between 1496 and 1611 prescribed from?

context: Significant legislative changes in the status of the szlachta, as defined by <a0_0>Robert Bideleux and Ian Jeffries<a0_0/>, consist of its <a1_0>1374 exemption from the land tax,<a1_0/> a 1425 guarantee against the 'arbitrary arrests and/or seizure of property' of its members, a 1454 <a2_0>requirement that military forces and new taxes be approved by provincial Sejms<a2_0/>, and statutes issued between 1496 and 1611 that prescribed the <a3_0>rights of commoners<a3_0/>.
